description: Debate-triggering hooks that generate strong engagement through polarizing opinions

examples: Unpopular opinion: Most productivity advice is just procrastination with extra steps
Unpopular opinion: AI will make most marketing jobs obsolete within 3 years
Unpopular opinion: Working from home is making us less creative
Hot take: LinkedIn is just Facebook for people who think they're too good for Facebook
Hot take: Most startups fail because founders are too proud to ask for help
Hot take: Remote work is killing company culture
Controversial truth: Your network matters more than your skills
Controversial truth: Most 'thought leaders' just repackage old ideas
Controversial truth: Hustle culture is just toxic positivity in disguise
I'm going to say it: Most online courses are just expensive YouTube videos
I'm going to say it: Networking events are awkward and inefficient
I'm going to say it: Most entrepreneurs are just unemployed people with better marketing
Fight me on this: Email is more productive than Slack
Fight me on this: Most innovation happens by accident, not design
Fight me on this: The best ideas come during boring meetings
This will upset people, but talent without persistence is worthless
This will upset people, but most 'disruptive' companies just have better marketing
This will upset people, but being busy doesn't mean being productive
Hear me out: Failure is overrated as a learning tool
Hear me out: Most successful people are just lucky with good timing
Hear me out: Perfectionism is often just fear disguised as standards
Nobody talks about this, but most mentorship is just ego validation
Nobody talks about this, but company culture is mostly performative
Nobody talks about this, but most networking is transactional

patterns.template: The truth nobody wants to hear: {harsh_reality}
examples: The truth nobody wants to hear: Your ideas aren't unique
The truth nobody wants to hear: Most passion projects fail because of poor execution
The truth nobody wants to hear: Being an entrepreneur isn't for everyone

patterns.template: Am I the only one who thinks {contrarian_view}?
examples: Am I the only one who thinks most TED talks are just motivational fluff?
Am I the only one who thinks open offices kill productivity?
Am I the only one who thinks most startup advice comes from survivorship bias?
